column4: unfortunately, making a dual-OS box increases the risk of those partition disasters
In what way is GNU tar not "full"?
the GNU version does not support sockets (it did in version 1.13 and earlier, but they removed that feature)
thanks ... I'll check into that one
nope, bsdtar can't do sockets, either
I think the problem is they all switched to using libarchive and libarchive itself is the problem
I guess I'll have to use cpio for now, but cpio is such a pain
What is the output of "file ubuntu-11.04-server-amd64-00-installed.img"? (if it's more than one line please use pastebin).
That doesn't look like a cpio image at all...
the file I named is not a cpio image ... it's a vm image I'm trying to package up in cpio
Why are you trying to package up a single file with cpio?
I wasn't ... that's the first file it broke on
What is your end goal? What features are you missing from GNU tar?
What error message are you getting with GNU tar?
What error message are you getting with GNU tar?
